text:
Running julia 1.5.1 remotely (so I am not completely sure how it is configured), after deleting my project and manifest toml in my .julia directory and uninstalling all my packages I get:

```(v1.5) pkg> add OrdinaryDiffEq
   Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General`
┌ Warning: Some registries failed to update:
│     — `~/.julia/registries/General` — registry dirty
└ @ Pkg.Types /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/Pkg/src/Types.jl:1194
  Resolving package versions...
Updating `/gpfs/home/tharvey2/.julia/environments/v1.5/Project.toml`
  [1dea7af3] + OrdinaryDiffEq v5.43.0
Updating `/gpfs/home/tharvey2/.julia/environments/v1.5/Manifest.toml`
  [79e6a3ab] + Adapt v2.3.0
  [ec485272] + ArnoldiMethod v0.0.4
  [4fba245c] + ArrayInterface v2.13.7
.
.
.
julia> using OrdinaryDiffEq
[ Info: Precompiling OrdinaryDiffEq [1dea7af3-3e70-54e6-95c3-0bf5283fa5ed]
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package Adapt [79e6a3ab-5dfb-504d-930d-738a2a938a0e] is required but does not seem to be installed:
 - Run `Pkg.instantiate()` to install all recorded dependencies.

Stacktrace:
 [1] _require(::Base.PkgId) at ./loading.jl:999
 [2] require(::Base.PkgId) at ./loading.jl:928
 [3] require(::Module, ::Symbol) at ./loading.jl:923
 [4] include(::Function, ::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:380
 [5] include(::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:368
 [6] top-level scope at none:2
 [7] eval at ./boot.jl:331 [inlined]
 [8] eval(::Expr) at ./client.jl:467
 [9] top-level scope at ./none:3
.
.
.```
It appears that only v5.43.0 of OrdinaryDiffEq is being downloaded every time...I am not sure if this is the issue, but I can't seem to get any more recent version to download...
Also instantiate did nothing
